Package org.deepnimma.interfaces.queue

Interface DNDeque<E>

Type Parameters:
E - The type of elements held in this deque.
All Superinterfaces:
DNQueue<E>, GenericStructure<E>
public interface DNDeque<E> extends DNQueue<E>
A queue that supports insertion and removal at both ends.

  • Method Details

    • addFirst

      void addFirst(E e)
      Inserts the specified element at the front of the deque. Throws an IllegalStateException if no space is currently available.
      Parameters:
      e - the element to add.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the element cannot be added due to capacity restrictions.
      NullPointerException - if the element is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if some property of the element prevents it from being added to this deque.

    • addLast

      void addLast(E e)
      Inserts the specified element at the end of the deque. Throws an IllegalStateException if no space is currently available.
      Parameters:
      e - the element to add
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the element cannot be added due to capacity restrictions.
      NullPointerException - if the element is null.
      IllegalArgumentException - if some property of the element prevents it from being added to this deque.

    • getFirst

      E getFirst()
      Get the element currently at the start of the deque. Throws NoSuchElementException if the deque is empty.
      Returns:
      the element currently at the start of the deque.
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if the deque is currently empty.

    • getLast

      E getLast()
      Get the element currently at the end of the deque. Throws NoSuchElementException if the deque is empty.
      Returns:
      the element currently at the end of the deque.
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if the deque is currently empty.

    • offerFirst

      boolean offerFirst(E e)
      Inserts the specified element at the front of this deque. Does not throw an exception when the deque is a capacity restricted deque.
      Parameters:
      e - the element to add
      Returns:
      true if the element has been added, otherwise false
      Throws:
      ClassCastException - if the class of the element does not allow the element to be added to the deque.
      NullPointerException - if the element is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if some property of the element prevents it from being added to this deque.

    • offerLast

      boolean offerLast(E e)
      Inserts the specified element at the end of this deque. Does not throw an exception when the deque is a capacity restricted deque.
      Parameters:
      e - the element to add
      Returns:
      true if the element has been added, otherwise false.
      Throws:
      ClassCastException - if the class of the element does not allow the element to be added to the deque.
      NullPointerException - if the element is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if some property of the element prevents it from being added to this deque.

    • peekFirst

      E peekFirst()
      Retrieves but does not remove the element at the start of the deque. Returns null if the deque is empty.
      Returns:
      the element at the start of the deque, or null if the deque is empty.

    • peekLast

      E peekLast()
      Retrieves but does not remove the element at the start of the deque. Returns null if the deque is empty.
      Returns:
      the element at the end of the deque, or null if the deque is empty.

    • push

      void push(E e)
      Pushes an element onto the stack represented by this deque. Throws an IllegalStateException if no space is currently available.
      Parameters:
      e - the element to add.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the element cannot be added due to space restrictions.
      ClassCastException - if the element's class hinders it from being added to the deque.
      NullPointerException - if the specified element is null.
      IllegalArgumentException - if any other property of the specified element prevents it from being added to the deque.

    • pop

      E pop()
      Pops an element from the stack represented by this deque. In other words, removes and returns the first element in this deque. Equivilant to removeFirst()
      Returns:
      the element at the front of this deque.
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if this deque is empty.

    • removeFirst

      E removeFirst()
      Retrieves and removes the first element of this deque. This method differs from pollFirst() only that it throws an exception if this deque is empty.
      Returns:
      the element at the head of this deque.
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if this deque is empty.

    • removeFirstOccurrence

      E removeFirstOccurrence(Object o)
      Removes the first occurrence of the specified element from this deque. If the deque does not contain the element, it is unchanged. More formally, removes the first element e such that Objects.equal(o, e) (if such an element exists). Returns true if this deque contained the specified element
      Parameters:
      o - the element to be removed from this deque, if present
      Returns:
      true if an element was removed as a result of this call.
      Throws:
      ClassCastException - if the class of the specified element is incompatible with this deque
      NullPointerException - if the specified element is null.

    • removeLast

      E removeLast()
      Retrieves and removes the last element of this deque. This method differs from pollLast() only that it throws an exception if this deque is empty.
      Returns:
      the element at the tail of this deque.
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if this deque is empty.

    • removeLastOccurrence

      E removeLastOccurrence(Object o)
      Removes the last occurrence of the specified element from this deque. If the deque does not contain the element, it is unchanged. More formally, removes the last element e such that Objects.equal(o, e) (if such an element exists). Returns true if this deque contained the specified element.
      Parameters:
      o - the element to be removed from this deque, if present
      Returns:
      true if an element was removed as a result of this call
      Throws:
      ClassCastException - if the class of the specified element is incompatible with this deque
      NullPointerException - if the specified element is null.
